result.execSummary:
The defendant Mickey J Frank Jr. was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Resisting or Obstructing an Officer, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 946.41(1).
  • Threats to Injure/Accuse of Crime, a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 943.30(1).
  • Disorderly conduct. This is not a criminal offense and results only in a money penalty for this offense.

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: Time served - huber and good time allowed.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Mickey J Frank Jr.

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.
Order Collection Biological Specimen DNA Analysis

records.addlTxt: Defendant Mickey J Frank in court with attorney Jeffery Joy.  Defendant Mickey J Frank in custody.  Charles James Simono appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Called at 10:17 AM. Called 15CF61, 15CF104, 15CF108 and 16CF116. State - resolved for change of plea - have complied with victim notification requirements and provides Court with those documents (VIS) - 15CF108 - plead G to count #1 and #4 as alleged, #3 - amend to county ordinance of DC with $1000 forfeiture plus costs, #2 and #5 - DRI, count #1 - $1000 fine plus costs, #4 - joint recokmmendation of 180 days in FC jail, $1000.00 fine plus costs; 15CF104 - #1 - amend to criminal tresspasing to a dwelling contrary to 943.14 - plead G - pay resitution of $1762.71 including VW surcharge (see restitution report for breakdown), court costs, #2 - amend to theft contrary  to 943.20(1)(a), court costs, #3 - amend to county ordinance of bail jumping with $1000 plus costs; 15CF61 - plead G to counts #1 and #4 as alleged, #2 - amend to City of Crandon ordinance of DC with $500.00 forfeiture plus costs, #3 - DRI, counts #1 and #4 - joint recommendation of a withheld sentence and place on probation for 3 years - consecutive to jail time on 15CF108 (count #4), #4 - 180 conditional jail - consecutive to 15CF108 jail time, each count has $500.00 fine plus costs; 16CF116 - #1 - amend to county ordinance of DC with a motor vehicle $1000.00 fine, counts #2, #3 and #4 - DRI, conditions of proibation are: AODA and follow thru and intend inpatient treatment at own expense if deemed necessary and, anger management and/or psychological assessment with follow thru, maintain absolute sobreity (no impairment from any source unless prescibed by a physician), no entry into any bars, tavenrs or Class B establishments, maintain/obtain full time employment/school, obtain HS diploma or equivalent if he doesn't have one, 200 hours commuinity service, take all meds as prescribed and in the manner in which they are prescribed by treating physician, no contact or affiliation with Tia Gilligan (7/23/491) or Louise Stone (6/11/95). Joy and Frank agree. Court has plea questionnaire. Court - discussion on bonds forfeited - no forfeitures were objected to. Court - 16CF116 - court dismisses and reads in counts #2, #3 and #4 and makes sure defendant understands what that means, #1 - amend to county ordinance of DC with a motor vehicle, pleasd G, finds G, fine of $1000.00 plus costs - confirms forfieture - take bond posted; 15CF108 - DRI counts #2 and #5; pleads G to count #1 as alleged and to count #4 as alleged; amends count #3 to county ordinance of DC - pleads G, finds G, fine of $1000.00 plus costs - take bond posted - confirms forfeiture; 15CF104 - amends count #3 to county ordinace of BJ, pleads G, finds G, fine of $1000.00 fine plus costs - take bond posted and confirms forfeiture; #1 - amend to criminal trespassing to a dwelling contrary to 943.14 - reads new charge and penalty - pleads G as amended; count #2 - amend to theft contrary to 943.20(1)(a) - reads new charge and penalty, pleads G to amended count; 15CF61 - #3 - DRI, amends count #2 to City of Crandon ordinance of DC, pleads G, finds G, fine of $500.00 plus costs - take bond posted - confirm forfeiture, Frank pleads G to counts #1 and #4 as alleged on same case. Court has plea questionnaire, goes thru it, finds the defendant has freely, voluntarily and intelligently waived his constitutional rights by entering his plea and right to JT, accepts plea, adjudges guilty, proceed to sentencing. State makes final argument prior to sentencing - follow joint recommendation. Joy makes final argument prior to sentencing - follow joint recommendation. Frank makes statement. Court sentences the defendant to the following: 15CF108 - #1 - $1000 fine plus costs - take bond posted; #4 - $1000.00 fine plus costs, 191 days in FC jail - huber and good time allowed - credit for time served (191 days) but Joy needs to submit a breakdown of the credit (State stipulates to all credit going on this case); 15CF104 - #1 - restitution of $1762.71 including VW surcharge - take bond posted or 60 DTP/CO, #2 - costs only; 15CF61 - counts #1 and #4 - withhold sentence and palce on probation for 3 years with conditions of: AODA and follow thru, anger management and follow thru and if inpatient is recommended - successfully complete that, psycholigical assesesment and follow thru, no entry into any bars or taverns, no consumption or possession of alcohol, maintain/obtain full time employment with verbage, attend at least one AA/NA or similar program each week, 200 hours of community service, take all medications as prescribed and in the manner in which they are prescribed, no contact with Tia Gilligan or Louise Stone, #1 - $500.00 fine plus costs, #4 - $500.00 plus costs, each count will get 1 year of conditional jail (consecutive to each other) - stay all but the 180 days and ordering a conservator appointed to him for his finances and if a conservator is not appointed - must serve the 2 years of conditional jail time (if the defendant gets a conservator ship - he only needs to serve 180 days in jail, otherwise will have to serve the 2 years total on the two counts; submit DNA sample, no possession of firearms and no voting rights, right to appeal, adjourned.
Plea/sentencing hearing on January 20, 2017 at 09:00 am.

Defendant Mickey J Frank appears via video from FOSO with attorney Jeffery Joy appearing telephonically.  Charles James Simono does not appear for the State of Wisconsin. Called 15CF61, 15CF108, 15CF104, 16CF116. Called 9:48 AM. Joy looking to review bond for stated reasons and has received an offer and believes there may be a resolution. Court indicates DA was aware of today's proceedings. Court has concerns with Frank not showing for court appearances in the past and does not grant Joy's motion at this point, bond will continue and advises Joy to get a FPT date if the matters are resolved.
Jury trial on January 26, 2017 at 08:30 am.
REFUSED TO SIGN. No consumption of alcohol. The defendant must contact his attorney once per week.

Defendant Mickey J Frank in court with attorney Jeffery Joy who appears telephonically with leave of the Court.  Charles James Simono appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Called at 10:50 AM. Called 15CF108, 16CF116, 15CF104, 15CF61. Frank informs the Court what is going on today. Court imposes $1000.00 jury fees today on the defendant. State - bond - increaee bond to $15,000.00 on each case. Joy - bond - understands frustration of State - believes defendant wants to resolve all matters - asks court to continue bond - asks Court to set 15CF108 and 16CF116 cases for JT. State responds - suggests putting a STC on all matters for 12/7/16 and still set all matters for JT, wants bond increased. Court - bond - $15,000 cash on each case, conditions are to contact his attorney not less than one time per week, sets all matters for JT for 15CF81 and 16CF116 on 1/26/17, and other matters will be set for status confernce.  Jury trial scheduled for January 26, 2017 at 08:30 am.
Jury trial on December 2, 2016 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Mickey J Frank appears via video from FC jail with attorney Jeffery Joy appearing by telephone.  Charles James Simono appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Called 11:00 AM. Called 15CF104, 15CF108, 16CF116, 15CF61. Court indicates all cases were scheduled for a status conference as well as Bond Hearing and questions parties as to what the status of each case is. State believes all cases should be scheduled for JT. Joy questions State regarding discovery. State believes it was all sent out. Court will set all cases for JT - 15CF108 to be #1, 16CF116 #2 and the others to follow. Joy would like to be heard on bond, asks for reduction to $5000 cash in each case. State does object to the reduction of bond on each case for stated reasons. Joy responds regarding a furlough that was granted. Court reduces cash bond to $5000 on each case with same conditions.  Jury trial scheduled for December 2, 2016 at 08:30 am.  Jury trial scheduled for December 2, 2016 at 08:30 am.
Status conference on October 12, 2016 at 09:00 am.

Same conditions as previously set.
Refused to sign.

Called 9:00 am. Called all cases arrested on. Defendant Mickey J Frank in custody, appears via video from FOSO.  Charles James Simono appeared for the State of Wisconsin. State updates on status of all cases. Court questions on attorney. Frank makes comment on his attorney. Court advises that all attorney's have been removed. Set for status. State asks for bond $7000 each case. Court orders no consumption of alcohol, and no contact with victims in 15cf104. Frank gets up and leaves video room prior to hearing being adjourned. Court now amends bonds to $10,000 for stated reasons on each case. October 12, 2016 @ 9:00 am.
Order allowing defense counsel to withdraw

records.descr: Motion and order for withdrawal of counsel

records.addlTxt: Attorney Michael a Verrilli in court.  Charles James Simono appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Called at 9:01 AM. Called 15CF108, 15CF104, 16CF116 and 15CF61. State - today was a date for JT for the defendant and then received an email from defense counsel that all matters would be plead to. Verrilli responds, does not know where the client is, did talk to him yesterday and he was willing to accept the plea offer from the State, believes he may have overslept. State - requests forfeiture of any bonds on all cases and requests a warrant, body or $2500.00 on each case. Verrilli - anticpated a warrant but asks for a lesser amount and no warrant on 16CF116 as that was not originally set for JT today, also asks if they can come back before the Court today if the defendant arrives. Court does forfiet bond on all cases and issues bench warrants, body or $5,000.00 on each case, will impose $1,000.00 jury fee but will hear argument at sentencing in regards to that. Verrilli again asks if the defendant appears today, can the matters still be heard today. Court responds, possibly if it is before 1:30 PM. State will probably be issuing additional charges of bail jumping now. State - offer will still exist if the defendant appears before 1:30 PM.
Jury trial on July 7, 2016 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Mickey J Frank in court with attorney Michael a Verrilli - who appears telephonically with leave of the Court.  Charles James Simono appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Called at 1:20 PM. Called 15CF61, 15CF104 and 15CF108. State - here for motion hearing. Verilli has filed a motion to reinstate modified bail and wishes to be heard on it - all bail was ordered forfeited in the matters and $5,000 cash was set - argues for that bond to be reinstated back to $1,000.00 on each case. State makes statement, no objections. Court will reinstate the bond of $1,000.00 on each case with same conditions and refund the $15,000.00 bond that was posted on all three matters. Clerk of Court to hold the $15,000.00 until the poster can pick up the check. Verrilli does not have discovery from previous attorneys. State will re-send discovery to Attorney Verrilli on all matters. Court will set the matters for JT, State will indicate which case will be set as #1 with the discovery that he sends to the attorney.  Jury trial scheduled for July 7, 2016 at 08:30 am.
Motion hearing on March 30, 2016 at 01:00 pm.
Motion hearing on March 18, 2016 at 01:00 pm.
Motion hearing on March 9, 2016 at 11:00 am.

records.descr: Motion and order for withdrawal of counsel

records.addlTxt: Attorney Leonard D. Kachinsky in court and appears telephonically with leave of the Court.  Charles James Simono appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Called at 8:56 AM. Also called 15CF104 and 15CF108. Kachinsky states that he does not have any paperwork from prior attorney Joy. State - going to ask for all bond to be forfeited, warrants for his arrest for at least $1000 higher than what the current bond is. Kachinsky reponds. Court will cancel the trial at this point for stated reasons, forfeits bond in all cases and issues bench warrants, body or $5000.00 on each case.

Attorney Jeffery Joy in court.  Charles James Simono appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Called 12:07 PM.  Called 15CF61, 15CF108 and 15CF104. Joy indicates he has filed a motion to withdraw, Frank had requested that he indicated he no longer wanted to be represented by Joy. Court cannot accept due to notice not being sent. Advises Joy to renotice. Re-called 2:22 PM. Mickey Frank now appears in person, court advises Frank of what took place this morning. Frank would like Joy to be removed from case and indicates he hired new counsel. Court allows Joy to withdraw as counsel. Court advises Frank to contact the new attorney to let them know the trial date is 1/28/15.
to Withdraw as Attorney of Record

Defendant Mickey J Frank in court with attorney Jeffery Joy.  Charles James Simono appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Called at 4:27 PM. Also called 15CF104 and 15CF108. Joy - not resolved - set matters for JT. State - plea offer - 15CF61 - G to count #1 as alleged and #4 as alleged, fines of $500 each plus costs, PSI; 15CF104 - #1 amended to class F burglary without arming oneself enhancer - G plead, plead G to count #2, #3 DRI; 15CF108 - plead to count #1 as alleged and #4 as alleged, remaining counts DRI, PSI with both parties free to argue. Joy and Frank agree. Court gives ramifications of rejecting the offer, set all matters for trial, continue bond on all cases. Joy has explained the ramification of rejecting the plea offer. Court sets all matters for JT.  Jury trial scheduled for January 28, 2016 at 08:30 am.

ADDRESS INFO for Mickey J Frank Jr.
Current: 909 East Grant Street, Crandon, WI 54520   (Effective: 10-21-2015)
Prior: 200 E Cobb Boulevard, Lot 12, Crandon, WI 54520

Defendant Mickey J Frank in court with attorney Jeffery Joy.  Defendant Mickey J Frank in custody.  Charles James Simono appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Called at 3:48 PM. Also called 15CF104 and 15CF108. State - believes all PH's are being waived and have filed Informations on all cases that mirror the complaint, offer was given a promise in 15CF104 to get the waiver of PH (no enhancer on count #1). Joy and Frank agree. Court has waiver of PH forms on all three cases, goes thru them, find the defendant has freely, voluntarily and intelligently waived his right to PH, finds probable cause on all cases, binds over for trial. Joy has Informations on all three cases and will proceed to ARGN, waives reading of them, enters NG pleas to all counts on all cases, set all matters for FPT, wants to address bond on all matters. Court accepts pleas on all cases and lets parties argue for bond. 15CF61 - bond is $5000 cash with no consumption of alcohol; 15CF108 - bond is $5000 cash - no additional conditions; 15CF104 - bond is $2000 cash - no additional conditions. Joy makes argument for bond reduction, asks for reduction in bond on all matters for stated reasons, possibly able to post $1000.00 cash on each case. State - bond - no objections to $1000.00 cash on each case. Frank believes there is a current warrant in Lac du Flambeau for $2500.00. Joy - will be able to make all bonds. Court modifies all bond to $1000.00 cash on each file, no consumption of alcohol on each file. Court sets all matters for FPT.  Final pre-trial scheduled for October 21, 2015 at 03:45 pm.

records.descr: Waiver of time limits for preliminary hearing

records.addlTxt: Attorney Jeffery Joy appears telephonically, defendant Mickey J Frank appears via video from FOSO.  Charles James Simono appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Called at 10:08 AM. Also called 15CF104 and 15CF61. Joy waives formal reading of all three complaints, waives time limits for all 3 cases and set all three matters for PH on 9/9/15. Joy makes argument for bond reduction - $2000.00 cash on each case for stated reasons. State - bond - objects to reduction in bond. Court will continue bond on all matters but will consider bond argument at ARGN, considers time limits waived, set for PH.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for September 9, 2015 at 02:45 pm.

Defendant Mickey J Frank in court, in custody and appears via video from FOSO.  Jodie L. Bednar appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Called at 9:40 AM. Also called 15CF61 and 15CF104. Frank does not have all complaints. State provides court officer with complaints for the defendant. Court reads charges and penalties and right to attorney and court appointed attorney. Frank understands charges and penalties. Court gives long explanation of the importance for an attorney and ramifications of appearing without an attorney again. Frank asks about bond reduction. 15CF108 - Cash bond is currently set at $5,000 cash. 15CF61 Cash bond is currently set at $5,000. Need to set bond on 15CF104. State - bond - 15CF104 - requests $1,000.00 cash bond. Frank - bond - asks for bond reduction. Court - sets bond of $2000.00 cash bond and continues bond on other cases. Court sets all matters for AIA.  Adjourned initial appearance scheduled for August 5, 2015 at 09:15 am.
No consumption of alcohol-must appear 7/15/15 at 9:00 am
